name: Helix, a Kimpton Hotel

reviews.text: I like the aesthetic of Kimpton Hotels and have had a good experience with them 90% of the time. The Helix is proximal to good restaurants, shopping and more in DC. My room was spacious. A King size bed, ample space in bathroom, sitting area. The layout of the room was a bit odd, with the bed divided from the room by a curtain to create a little sleep pod. It was a little too Barbarella for me.
reviews.title: Good location, solid Kimpton experience

reviews.text: The hotel lounge outdoors was enjoyable on a summer night. The food was surprisingly good and the drinks were well-crafted. The free happy hour is a nice perk.
reviews.title: Fun Funky Hotel

reviews.text: The gym just has the basics, treadmill, free weights. Not large by any means. I was glad to be the only one there because you could not fit more than two people working out in the space.
reviews.title: A different kind of stay - In line with other Kimptons

reviews.text: All in all, I recommend this hotel. If you are a Kimpton lover, definitely choose this hotel over the Donovan House (although Donovan has a great rooftop bar).
reviews.title: My first choice of all the fantastic Kimptons in DC

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Hotel Helix is a pop art styled hotel that is very friendly and offers a range of services like free shoe shines, a hosted wine happy hour, and free coffee and tea in the restaurant in the mornings. They even offer free bikes! It is a great concept and the staff were professional and personal.
reviews.title: Nice quirky hotel- definitely not a run-of-the-mill-hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is one of the most pocket-friendly of the Kimpton franchise in Washington. Like they say, no effort is saved so you can feel like a rock star. The purple curtain at the entrance, the very friendly staff and the colorful walls invite you to party.
reviews.title: Great hotel, Beautiful room, Best sleep in our vacations

reviews.text: But the room is a nice rest area. Large and ultra confortable bed, lots of room space, a cool bathroom (although a bit small and dated) and a sit area, with perfecly working air conditioning.
reviews.title: Helix is my go-to DC hotel!
Exciting Colorful Decor
reviews.text: Other cool touches: Cold refreshments at the lobby all day, the Sparkling Hour, with free drinks daily from 5:00 to 6:00 p.m., and, when affiliated to their loyalty program (Kimpton InTouch), free wifi and US$10,00 to spend at the minibar.
The only downsides were the price of the business center and the lak of space in the fridge for our things, even with an ice machine next to our door.
reviews.title: Lively but not too noisy

reviews.text: I returned for another stay at the Helix - what a treasure. The location is perfect for either walking to the Mall for museum activities or for a stroll towards DuPont Circle. There are great restaurants nearby (Commissary on P Street), a Whole Foods around the corner, and well as unique shops on 14th Street. I have family in the neighborhood and the convenience for me to be so near their home as well as close to all the desirable sites is a huge bonus for us. The staff remembers me by name, check-in is swift and the room is ALWAYS in clean and orderly condition. Love the FUN decor! As with other stays, I slept soundly and was pleased to enjoy the fabulous coffee/tea bar in the lounge upon waking. Afternoon social hour is always a great time to mingle with other guests and relax with complimentary wine or beer. So many travelers want their pet to accompany them and a pet-friendly hotel is a real plus for including your furry friends. My little Jack Russell came on a trip last year, so cute to see him walking down the hall to our room. Kimpton Hotels rock (!) and the Helix was my first!
reviews.title: good, but ...

reviews.text: I spent the weekend at Hotel Helix and enjoyed my stay. There are dozens of great restaurants within a few block radius of the hotel (Thai, american, pubs, breakfast, etc). The hotel is easy to get to by public transport or cab (a 10 min walk from the Metro). It is dog friendly so don't be surprised if you see a few around the hotel (on leashes of course).
reviews.title: Great location, funky decor

reviews.text: This hotel definitely has the "boutique" feel. The decor is abstract and funky. Colors are bright and contemporary. The beds are comfortable, TVs are large. Our bathroom was on the small side, but still acceptable. The hotel is a little worn. I am not a person that looks for these kind of things, but noticed that it's been a while since it was renovated. In no way did it feel dirty or old, but some surface corners are peeling and you'll notice it.
reviews.title: Another Outstanding stay at a Phenomenal Hotel ~ The Helix!

reviews.text: Having said that, I was incredibly comfortable in our room. Free WiFi worked perfectly. The lounge has nice indoor and outdoor seating. Workout room is small, but has a treadmill, bike, and elliptical machines. My friend stayed in a large suite with a great view of DC on the 10th floor. The wine reception is small, but great for a few pre-dinner drinks.
reviews.title: Dirty and loud facility, with a valet that damaged my vehicle.

reviews.text: Overall, this hotel is great because it's affordable, in a great DC location, and has everything you need for a comfortable stay.
reviews.title: Hotel Helix

reviews.text: This past June we had the pleasure of staying at the Hotel Helix, AGAIN! for an extended weekend while in Washington D.C. for the International Fancy Food Show/convention......., The Hotel Helix is Superb in every sense of the word .From the ease of check-in/check-out proceedures to the exceptional friendly & knowledgeable staff you will NOT be disappointed here. The front desk staff, as well as the bellman recomended some terrific restaurants! The Helix also has a Great Location TOO!, with a Caribou Coffee shop rite on the corner, Whole foods, CVS and many restaurants & cafes on "P" street a block away. Walking distance to Dupont Circle as well as the Convention Center make this hotel a true gem. There is also a Metro bus stop on the corner. Our suite, # 620, complete with pop-culture decor was 100% clean & very comfortable from the HUGE sectional sofa to the heavenly bed. The Internet access/signal was outstanding in our room. Fresh hot complimentary coffee every morning as well as ice water & lemonade in the afternoon/evening PLUS a complimentary "bubbly hour" from 5-6 everyday in the lobby /outdoor terrace. The Hotel Helix is also 100% dog/pet friendly. Looking foward to our next trip to Washington DC & the Hotel Helix and will highly recommend the Hotel Helix to all our friends, relatives and business associates........Overall Rating~Phenomenal/ Excellent
reviews.title: Simply Amazing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great hotel in a convenient location. Funky, chic decorations in the rooms and as with all Kimpton hotels the bedding was very comfortable. The Helix lounge was a comfortable place to relax and have a cocktail and the wine reception was fun. If there was a down side it was the $39 Valet parking
reviews.title: Another Great Kimpton Property

reviews.text: Whenever I go to DC, I make a point of staying at the Helix (even if I'm attending a conference at another hotel). Staff is wonderful, amenities are top-notch, rooms and beds fabulous. It's in a great neighborhood -- lots of restaurants nearby, as well as a killer Whole Foods market around the corner if you prefer to eat in. Connecticut Avenue and Dupont Circle are only a few blocks away.
reviews.title: Helix is incomparable!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: While planning for a weekend in the DC area, we stumbled on the Helix as a pet-friendly hotel. With the central location, close to our grandson, it couldn't be outdone. Greeting was warm and friendly and our country coonhound soon adapted to the elevator and urban environment. The room was spacious, clean and comfortable. The dog bed received a big "paws up" from Easy and the staff was uniformly friendly and helpful. The small park at Logan circle was a convenient place to walk the dog. With the dog, we didn't try to take advantage of the dining facilities or the wine hour, but maybe next time.
reviews.title: Great Pet-Friendly Experience

reviews.text: Overall, I was delighted with my stay! The staff was attentive, my room was cheerful (where in DC can you have a mural of a surfer, behind the bed?) and the "bubbly hour" was just what I needed after a long day of business! The complimentary coffee was also nice...would have preferred it to be in my room but the quick walk to the restaurant wasn't so bad either. I will definitley be back!
reviews.title: Get a little Funky in DC!!

reviews.text: I stayed at the Helix for three nights in May while attending a conference in D.C. I have to agree with the reviewer who commented on the seediness of the hotel. The first impression was generally a little run down, but not terrible. I left for dinner immediately upon arrival and returned to my room after 11 pm. When I went to get into bed, the carpet next to the bed was soaking wet - looked like it was seeping from a locked door that I assume housed some HVAC. I could live with that. But when I pulled back the sheets, the bed was dirty!! I won't describe it - but it was disgusting!! There was no housekeeping at that time of night. Someone brought me a set of clean sheets. Not ideal. Then the sink in the bathroom backed up - also disgusting. I tried to get a room at another hotel the next day, but the few rooms available - including at other Kimpton hotels - were $500 plus. I would have expected Kimpton might have let me stay at one of the other hotels for what I was paying at the Helix - or something close. They did move me to another room the next day that was acceptable. But the hotel itself just didn't seem clean or well-maintained - trash on the floor of the elevator that stayed there for a couple days, general wear and tear. I've stayed in other Kimpton hotels in other cities and have generally been very satisfied, and I'm not particularly demanding - as long as my room is clean and things are generally acceptable, I won't complain. But this was the worst hotel experience I've ever had in many years of travel for business and vacation.
reviews.title: Terrible experience

description: Hotel Helix is a swanky boutique hotel fashionably located in Washington DC's downtown Logan Circle neighborhood. Fun, hip and smart, this Kimpton Hotel delights the moment you walk through its doors. The bright colors and ultra-mod style are matched by luxurious, sparkling service and careful attention to detail. Hotel Helix, complete with the adjacent Helix Lounge, is a glamorous base for exploring the nearby White House, Washington Monument, Smithsonian Museums and more.
